[[File:Civil Ensign of Hungary.svg|22px]] [[Antal Esterházy]] general |strength1=ca. 15,000 |strength2=Unknown |casualties1= |casualties2= }} The '''Battle of Zvolen''' ({{lang-hu|Zólyomi csata,}} {{lang-de|Schlacht bei Altsohl,}} {{lang-sk|Bitka pri Zvolenu}}) was a battle between the [[Kuruc]]'s and the army of [[Habsburg Monarchy]] in November 15, 1703 at [[Zvolen]] in Upper Hungary (modern day [[Slovakia]]). General [[Miklós Bercsényi]] was routed the [[Austrians|Asutrian]] army under [[Simon Forgách]]. Forgách in 1704 went over to the Kuruc side. == Prelude == [[Francis II Rákóczi]] in June 15 sparked off the war the independence against Emperor [[Leopold I, Holy Roman Emperor|Leopold I]]. First Rákóczi found little support in [[Hungary]] and also the nobility and peasants fought against the Kurucs. Miklós Bercsényi soon brought mercenaries from [[Poland]], [[Moldavia]] and the [[Ruthenians|Ruthenian]] ([[Ukraine|Western Ukrainian]]) regions. The Kuruc forces and his mercenaries (with the [[Slovaks|Slovak]] and [[Rusyns|Rusyn]] minorities) pushed forward into the Austrian border. In September 17 [[Levice]] captured by the Kurucs, but the Austrian army recaptured in October 31. == Opposing forces == [[László Ocskay]] brigadeer joined Bercsényi after the capture of Levice. The Kuruc and Austrian army was mostly cavalry. The Kuruc forces have irregular Hungarian and Slovak horsemen, some regular horsemen, well-trained [[Poles|Polish]] and Ruthenian cavalry, some thousand veteran haiduks from [[Great Turkish War]], [[French people|French]] officiers and soldiers, and [[Moravians (ethnic group)|Moravian]] artillerymen with obsolete guns. Bercsényi's lieutenants was [[Sándor Károlyi]] and Ocskay. In the Austrian army twoo regiment infantry with muskets, some platoons of [[Serbs|Serbian]] fusiliers from [[Vojvodina]], [[Hungarians|Hungarian]] Royalists and [[Danes|Danish]] dragoons. His commanders was also Hungarians: Forgách, [[János Bottyán|Bottyán the Blind]] and [[Antal Esterházy]] (later everyone Kuruc commanders). In both camps were disagreements between the commanders. An other Austrian army was in [[Záhorská Bystrica|Bystrica]] under [[Leopold Schlick]], just celebrated his name day, assist those not bothered about Forgáchs. == The battle == The Kuruc and Austrian army glared at each other for a long time. The thirst tormented the troops, there was little water. Before the battle Bottyán and Ocskay dueled, and both injured. In the battle the Kuruc forces repulsed the Austrians and their allies. After the battle Austrians locked themselves in Zvolen. Bercsényi tried to starve them. During the night, most of the army tried to break out of the castle. But Ocskay raided the Austrians and destroyed them; very small soldiers reached the camp of Schlick in Bystrica. == Aftermath == The wounded Bottyán was the Zvolen castle for three weeks. In December 7 surrendered in exchange for free getaway. The Kurucs occupied the country between Levice and Zvolen, and in several battles defeated the Austrian, Danish and Serbian forces. == Sources == * [http://www.magyar-varak.hu/magyar/varak_tortenet.php?azonosito=5431&betuazonosito=Z Zólyom - vártörténet (magyar-varak.hu)] * [http://mek.oszk.hu/00700/00794/html/jokai9.htm Jókai Mór: Szeretve mind a vérpadig (mek.oszk.hu)] {{DEFAULTSORT:Zvolen, Battle}} [[Category:Battles involving Hungary]] [[Category:Battles involving Austria]] [[Category:Battles involving Denmark]] [[Category:Battles involving France]] [[Category:Habsburg period in the history of Slovakia]] [[Category:1703 in Europe]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1703]]
